Principal Investigator – American Corrections: Why and how U.S. prisons reshape and

Will Perpetual Help End?¸© Sawbuck Productions.
Ethnographic documentary film examining how learned roles prevent the development of frameworks for sustainability
within small community-based organizations. Mentored by Associate Professor Greg Scott, DePaul University (2009)
Research Assistant – Social Science Research Center, DePaul University.
Provide comprehensive methodological assistance to social science researchers at DePaul including training in NVivo,
Atlas TI, and SPSS (2010)
Project Coordinator - Analyst - Research Assistant
Community Health and Needs Assessment Study (CHANA), DePaul University, Alivio Medical Center, Chicago

Medical Center, Principal Investigators. Mixed-methods study examining immigrant health in four, primarily
Mexican, Chicago community areas. (2008-2009)
The Greenbelt Movement & DePaul University
o Applied GIS Mapping project in Mt. Kenya National Park designed to assist the Greenbelt Movement
in the establishment in the selection of viable geographies to place on the global bio-carbon credit market.
o Ethnography at the Family Level researching the impact and diffusion of Green Belt Movement
interventions to protect food security with professors Howard Rosing and Patrick McHaffie
